name: Jordan King
introduction: Jordan King (born 26 February 1994 in Warwick, Warwickshire, England, United Kingdom) is a British racing driver who formerly served as a test driver for the Manor Racing team while competing in the GP2 Series. He is the son of Manor Racing chairman Justin King. He won the 2013 British Formula Three Championship. After the Manor team closed at the start of 2017, King competed as a part-time driver in the 2018 IndyCar Series.[1]
